717574f.text:
Broadway, south from West 53rd Street, showing in the foreground the B. S. Moss, Broadway Theatre at the S.W. corner of the aforementioned point. Note the varied electrical signs on this, the "White Way" as viewed towards Times Square.
About 1932.
E. C. I. Publishers.

717575f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, north from West 53rd Street, showing prominently two 12-story structures, 828-830 and 832-838. The first of these, houses the Manhattan Music Hall and the latter the Hotel Cumberland (formerly the Adlon). The hotel is directly at the S.W. corner of West 54th Street.
This set consists of a negative and a positive view.
September 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.

717575f-b.text:
Broadway, west side, north from West 53rd Street, showing prominently two 12-story structures, 828-830 and 832-838. The first of these, houses the Manhattan Music Hall and the latter the Hotel Cumberland (formerly the Adlon). The hotel is directly at the S.W. corner of West 54th Street.
This set consists of a negative and a positive view.
September 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.

713664f-a.text:
West 53rd Street, west from Broadway, showing the progress made on the W. P. A. repaving project at this point.
April 23, 1937
W. P. A., photo
Five Boroughs Project
